name: Avoid Functions and Procedures not testing the SQLCODE return code after each SQL statement (PL1)
description:
This rule searches all PL1 Main Procedures, PL1 Functions and PL1 Procedures having the number of EXEC SQL  (A) and compute the number of times SQLCODE appears in a testing statement (B). If A < B  then the procedure is listed as a violation.
Two following SQL statements are to be ignored :
EXEC SQL DECLARE CURSOR
EXEC SQL INCLUDE
output:
This report lists all the all PL1 Main Procedures, PL1 Functions and PL1 Procedures having the number of EXEC SQL  (A) and compute the number of times SQLCODE appears in a testing statement (B). If A < B  then the procedure is listed as a violation.
 It provides the following information:  PL1 Main Procedures, PL1 Functions and PL1 Procedures full name.
rationale: Not testing DB2 return code will produce unpredictable behavior.
remediation: Try to always provide testing code after all SQLCODE return after each SQL statement
total: Number of  PL1 Main Procedures, PL1 Functions and PL1 Procedures.
